sen.j: 五郎八姫（いろはひめ、文禄3年6月16日 (旧暦)（1594年8月2日） － 寛文元年5月8日 (旧暦)（1661年6月4日））は、徳川家康の六男・松平忠輝の正室。
sen.e: Irohahime (August 2, 1594 - June 4, 1661) was the legitimate wife of Tadateru MATSUDAIRA, the sixth son of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.
Irohahime (August 2, 1594 - June 4, 1661) was the legal wife of Tadateru MATSUDAIRA, the sixth son of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.

sen.e: Her father was Masamune DATE (Irohahime was the eldest daughter).

sen.j: 母は正室の愛姫（田村清顕の娘）。
sen.e: Her mother was the legitimate wife, Yoshihime (or Megohime) (daughter of Kiyoaki TAMURA).
Her mother was Masamune's legal wife, Yoshihime (or Megohime), the daughter of Kiyoaki TAMURA.

sen.j: 1594年6月16日、京都の聚楽第屋敷にて生まれた。
sen.e: In June 16, 1594, she was born in Jurakudai mansion in Kyoto.

sen.j: 政宗と正室の愛姫との間に結婚15年目にして初めて授かった待望の嫡出子であった。
sen.e: She was a long-awaited legitimate child born to Masamune and his legitimate wife Yoshihime after 15 years from their wedding.

sen.e: She was the long-awaited first child of Masamune and his wife, Yoshihime, who had been married for 15 years.

sen.j: 当然夫妻は伊達家後継者となる男児誕生を熱望していたであろうが、生まれた子は女だった。
sen.e: It was needless to say that her parents would have been longing for a boy who were to succeed the Date clan; on the contrary, the baby born to them was a girl.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although the couple would obviously have been longing for a boy to take over the Date Clan, the baby born to them was a girl.

sen.j: このため、男子名の名である五郎八しか考えていなかった政宗が、そのまま五郎八姫と命名したといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that the parents had only prepared the boy's name, Gorohachi (五郎八), and Masamune named the baby girl as it is, Irohahime (五郎八姫, the same Chinese characters with different pronunciation).
It is said that the parents had only chosen a boy's name, Gorohachi (五郎八), so Masamune decided to use the same Chinese characters with a different pronunciation.

sen.j: 「御男子の故を以て名付け玉へるは、北御方（正夫人の意、ここでは愛姫を指す）の御腹に嗣君誕生し玉はん事をあらかじめ祝し玉ふと云云」（「伊達治家記録」より）。
sen.e: They say they named the child the boy's name, because they celebrate the birth of heir from kitanokata (legitimate wife, here, Yoshihime) in anticipation.' (from 'Date Jige Kiroku or Date Chika Kiroku').
They say they gave the child a boy's name because they were anticipating celebrating kitanokata (legitimate wife; here, Yoshihime) giving birth to an heir' (from 'Date Jige Kiroku').

sen.j: 五郎八姫は、聚楽第から伏見、大坂と各地を転々としたが、1599年1月20日に有力大名との関係を深めようとする家康の策謀の一つとして、家康の子・忠輝と婚約することとなる。
sen.e: Having moved from place to place, from Jurakudai to Fushimi, and then to Osaka, Irohahime engaged to Ieyasu's son, Tadateru on January 20, 1599, which was one of plots Ieyasu figured out to have closer relationship with strong daimyo (feudal lord).

sen.j: 1603年には伏見から江戸に移り、1606年12月24日に忠輝と結婚した。
sen.e: In 1603, she moved from Fushimi to Edo, and on December 24, 1606, she married Tadateru.

sen.j: 忠輝とは仲睦まじかったが子供は生まれなかったと言われている。
sen.e: It is said although she and Tadateru were a loving couple, they had no child.

sen.j: そして1616年、忠輝が改易されると離縁され、父の政宗のもとに戻り、以後は仙台で暮らした。
sen.e: When a bill of attainder was passed for Tadateru, Irohahime was divorced and returned to her father Masamune and lived in Sendai thereafter.

sen.e: As she lived in Nishikan (the west annex) to the main castle in this period, she was also called Nishikan-dono.

sen.e: When she divorced Tadateru, she was still young in her early twentieth so that her father Masamune and her mother Yoshihime were concerned about their beloved Irohahime and, allegedly, offered her remarriage, but she kept declining that.

sen.e: It is generally accepted that she had refused offers of marriage through rest of her life no matter how earnestly her parents and those around her advised her to remarry, because she believed in Christianity which does not allow 'remarriage' in its dogma.
